newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Fire destroys Bahrain restaurant, no casualties.
newsitem.headline: Fire destroys Bahrain restaurant, no casualties.

text.p: An apparent arson attack destroyed a restaurant in Bahrain, causing extensive damage but no casualties, a government official said on Tuesday.
"The fire took place on Monday and completely gutted the restaurant. There were no casualties," he told Reuters.
He said the restaurant was closed when the blaze occured. "Initial indications showed the fire was a sabotage act," he added.
The fire was the latest in a series of arson attacks to hit Bahrain, the Gulf's main financial and banking centre.

A Bangladeshi man was killed and another was injured when arsonists attacked a cold store in Sitra, linked with the capital Manama by a three km (1.8 miles) causeway, on Saturday. Four suspects had been arrested after the attack.
A power generator blew up at a luxury hotel on Saturday, but there were no reports of damage or casualties.
On Friday, a restaurant was set ablaze in a Manama district and three other fires broke out in Muharraq, linked with Manama by another three km (1.8 miles) causeway.
Four Indians died from smoke inhalation and a fifth was critically injured after fire gutted a shop in Manama in June.
A series of arson attacks in early June were described by a government official as "continued acts of terrorism."

Members of the islands's majority Shi'ite Moslem community have waged sporadic protests, bombings and arson attacks since December 1994 to press the Sunni-led government to introduce economic and political reforms.
